response: "I feel like I'm constantly under a microscope. Every little flaw is magnified."
"Why do I feel like I have to be perfect all the time? It's exhausting."
"I can't keep up with everyone's expectations of me. It's too much."
"I feel like I'm losing myself in trying to meet society's standards of beauty and success."
"I don't even know what's real anymore. It's like everything is a facade."
"I wish I could just be myself without worrying about what others think."
"It's like I'm competing with everyone around me and I can never measure up."
"I'm so tired of feeling like I'm not enough. When will it be okay to just be me?"
"I wish society would stop putting so much pressure on girls to be perfect."
"Sometimes I feel like giving up because the standards are so unattainable."
